Module kivakit.commandline
Package com.telenav.kivakit.commandline

Class ArgumentParser<T>

java.lang.Object
com.telenav.kivakit.commandline.ArgumentParser<T>
public class ArgumentParser<T> extends Object
Parses a command-line Argument, as defined by a Quantifier, a type, a string converter for that type and a human-readable description. An argument parser can be passed to Argument.get(ArgumentParser) to retrieve the value of an argument.

Built-In Parsers

Several argument parsers can be created with static methods:

  • booleanArgumentParser(Listener listener, String) - An argument that can be true or false
  • integerArgumentParser(Listener listener, String) - An integer argument
  • longArgumentParser(Listener listener, String) - A long argument
  • stringArgumentParser(Listener listener, String) - A string argument
  • stringArgumentParser(Listener listener, String) - A string argument

Parser Builders

New argument parsers can be created with the argument parser ArgumentParser.Builder, which can be accessed through builder(Class). The type parameter is the type of the argument parser being built. For example, a float switch would be of type Float.class. The builder then allows attributes of the argument parser to be specified:

  • ArgumentParser.Builder.description(String) - A description of what the argument is for
  • ArgumentParser.Builder.required() - The user must provide the argument or it is an error
  • ArgumentParser.Builder.optional() - The user can omit the argument
  • ArgumentParser.Builder.oneOrMore() - The user must provide one or more arguments of this type
  • ArgumentParser.Builder.twoOrMore() - The user must provide two or more arguments of this type
  • ArgumentParser.Builder.zeroOrMore() - The user can provide zero or more arguments of this type
  • ArgumentParser.Builder.converter(Converter) - Converts the argument string to an object

Example

This example provides a builder to create argument parsers for Version objects. The value specified on the command line will be converted from a string to a Version object with VersionConverter. Many classes in KivaKit provide string converters, which makes it an easy job to construct argument parsers. 

 public static SwitchParser.Builder<Version> argumentParser(Listener listener, String description)
 {
     return SwitchParser.builder(Version.class)
         .converter(new Version.Converter(listener))
         .description(description);
 }

     [...]

 SwitchParser<Version> VERSION = argumentParser("The input file version")
     .required()
     .build();
